content: you why lock here welcome back here's
another neat little door to add to your collection so get some chipboard measure
in one inch and then freehand draw half of the arch just make sure your design
whatever it is is contained within that one inch width the height is up to you
cut out your shape draw some lines indicating one inch
intervals to give you some guidance and begin to draw copies of the shape by
using it as a stencil I recommend that you make six copies
I'll cut them out and hot glue three of them together as shown
here we're going to use the same technique as we use for our secret doors
for the wall clip so I won't go into too much detail if you need a refresher
watch episode 16 bottom line is create the wall clip from a playing card hot
glue each shape to the clip as shown and when they've had sufficient time to
harden glue the tips of the archways together you should now find that the
whole thing is very solid paint it up how you want
I made it match my dungeon scheme optionally you can adorn the peak of the
arch with some kind of bauble I'm just using a couple beads from an assorted
mix from Michaels and we'll show it in context then this is why that 1 inch was
so important if the ends of the arches are two inches away then this is
guaranteed to always fit in a dead-end piece which will be the most limiting as
far as space is concerned so I'm why lock thank you for joining me and I will
see you next time
